channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report E-2023110115
item.description:
Report E-2023110115

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-14T18:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-13
  • City: SALEM
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 13, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN3266 were damaged due to a load strap failure and released approximately seven (7) gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. A pH test was performed before remediation and a neutral reading was confirmed. An on-site forklift was used to remove all cargo from the trailer for better access to the spill. The damaged pails were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal purposes. FCE personnel deployed absorbent boom around a nearby drain as a precautionary measure during remediation activities. Crews deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. All UN3266-impacted material was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023100506
item.description:
Report X-2023100506

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: LORTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023100506 SequenceEvent: The package was discovered leaking on a trailer during the sort. Upon discovering that it was a damaged hazardous material, the package was left at our stations damage staging area and moved to the hazmat cage for further processing. DescribePack: A loose cap on the bottle leaked corrosive liquid throughout the package. The liquid damaged the exterior of the box as well. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The items where placed upright so there would be no more spillage of corrosive liquid. The package was also isolated so as to not be breathed in by the package handlers. 2. X-2023100507 SequenceEvent: The package was discovered leaking on a trailer during the sort. Upon determining that it was a damaged hazmat, the package was left at our stations damage staging area and moved to the hazmat cage for further processing. DescribePack: A loose cap on the bottle leaked some of the corrosive liquid throughout the package. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The items where placed upright so there would be no more spillage, and the caps were secured and checked on the undamaged bottles. 3. X-2023100508 SequenceEvent: The package was discovered leaking during the sort. Upon discovery that it was a hazardous material, the package was left at our stations damage staging area and moved to the hazmat cage for further processing. DescribePack: A loose cap leaked corrosive liquid throughout the package; the exterior of the box was corroded by the hazardous material as well. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: The items where placed upright so there would be no more spillage. The package was also isolated to prevent inhalation of toxic fumes.

item.title: Report X-2023100501
item.description:
Report X-2023100501

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: NORFOLK
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This morning the package handlers were unloading a trailer and found the damaged hazmat inside the belly leaking. The station where it came from loaded and tossed the box on the ground causing one of the cleaner bottles to crack and spill. DescribePack: The cleaner was leaking from the bottom of the bottle. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: The damaged hazmat was placed in a yellow drum.

item.title: Report X-2023100325
item.description:
Report X-2023100325

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-08T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: DUBLIN
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pail was pulled off trailer and was leaking due to crack in bottom. Approximately 5 gal of 55 gal leaked out. Cleaned up with absorbent material and put all contents in lined tote for inspection. DescribePack: Plastic pail has approximately 5 inch crack in bottom DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Pail was taken from trailer and placed in lined tote, along with all absorbent material, paper towels, gloves, etc. and placed in damaged hazmat holding cage
